p: Orange fruit used in this research were Citrus sinensis Osbeck CV. Valencia, grown in Ramsar. The orange peels were separated from the endocarp and cut into approximately 2 × 5 × 3 mm pieces giving a yield of 20 % (w/w) of peels with regard to total fruit. The peels were softly dried at 45 °C in a drying oven by a flowing air at 12 h. The moisture content reached 40% by weight on dry basis. They were stored in the refrigerator until treatments.
